result.execSummary:
The defendant Veronica A McDade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
9-29-2016 -   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.

No Contact with the Burlington Coat Factory or any victims or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED, for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Veronica A McDade in court with Attorney Joan B Broughton.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence.  State files an amended information. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Broughton makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME    **CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE**

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR     **CONCURRENT**       **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with:Burlington Coat Factory or any victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaint 

RESTITUTION:   -$0-

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:   60 DAYS, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - (to be used at agent's discretion)
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Veronica A McDade in court with Attorney Joan B Broughton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Broughton requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Veronica A McDade in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.  Brian J Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Veronica A McDade in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Defendant to have no contact with the business or any witness listed in the complaint. Comply with all rules of her probation and her agent.

Defendant Veronica A McDade in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
